headline: Kraft Heinz downgraded to Neutral from Overweight at Piper Sandler
summary: Piper Sandler downgraded Kraft Heinz (KHC) to Neutral from Overweight with a price target of $35, down from $40. The firm notes that its prior thesis of improving retail momentum with incremental foodservice initiatives depended on improving retail, but that hasn’t materialized, the analyst tells investors in a research note. The stock is now at 52-week lows, and while the timing of the downgrade may prove wrong, Piper needs visibility and confidence in better U.S. retail momentum to remain posi

headline: Charlie Munger Pointed Out The Extreme Brand Loyalty People Have For Ketchup – 'They Want Heinz! And So You Can Raise The Price Of Heinz'
summary: What makes Heinz ketchup so special that people won't settle for anything else? To Charlie Munger, the answer was simple: it's not just ketchup – it's a brand with unmatched loyalty. And in his view, that loyalty made it a gold mine. Don't Miss: Can you guess how many Americans successfully retire with $1,000,000 saved? The percentage may shock you. Many are using this retirement income calculator to check if they’re on pace — here’s a breakdown on how on what’s behind this formula. CD Popularit

headline: Kraft Heinz cut at Piper Sandler on retail headwinds
summary: Investing.com -- Piper Sandler downgraded Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) to Neutral from Overweight on Tuesday, lowering the price target to $35 from $40, citing ongoing retail challenges that overshadow potential growth in its foodservice business.

headline: BlackRock Mid-Cap Value Fund Q3 2024 Commentary
summary: BlackRock Mid-Cap Value Fund posted returns of 7.87% (Institutional shares) and 7.83% (Investor A shares, without sales charge) for the third quarter of 2024.
